Mes tikime, kad šis veikimo principas yra saugesnis už kai kurių kitų tiekėjų veikimo principus, kurių šifravimas vyksta internete ir raktus sukuria tiekėjas arba jie nesukuriami visai. Pavyzdžiui jei MEGA vartotojo failai būtų pasiekiami dėl programinės klaidos, jų būtų neįmanoma perskaityti be vartotojo sukurto iššifravimo rakto.

Kadangi HTTPS protokolas nėra našus, mes jums leidžiame saugumą panaikinti, tose naršyklėse, kurios palaiko šią funkciją (Chrome, Safari ir Firefox iki 17 versijos) tai pagreitins jūsų failų perdavimą be pavojaus konfidencialumui ar jūsų duomenims. Mes stengiamės įgyvendinti tai su HTML5 webCrypto API pagalba ir suderinti jį su visomis pagrindinėmis naršyklėmis, kas pašalintų minėtas problemas.

1821: Kai mes paleidome MEGA ankstyvais 2013-aisiais, nęsąžininga vyriausybė vis dar vykdė globalų masinį sekimą, o kova su terorizmu tebuvo tik pretekstas jam vykdyti. Edvardo Snoudeno pareiškimas po 137-ių dienų iš esmės pakeitė visuomenės požiūrį ir visiems tapo aišku, kad saugumo politika ("mes turime prieigą prie jūsų duomenų, tačiau mes pažadame laikyti juos konfidencialiais ir nesinaudoti jais") nėra pakankamai gera. Viskas išskyrus saugumo planą ("mes negalime padidinti prieigos prie jūsų duomenų be jūsų žinios"), dėl kurio stiprus end-to-end šifravimas yra būtina sąlyga, dabar atrodo grubiai nepakankama.
1822: MEGA buvo sukurta laikantis paprasto principo, kad norint jog kriptografija būtų priimtina ir naudojama, ji neturėtų kliudyti praktiškumui. MEGA yra pilnai prieinama be išankstinių programinės įrangos diegimų ir  išlieka tik kaip cloud saugyklos tiekėjas su didelio našumo ištisiniu šifravimu. Vienintelis matomas ženklas, kad kriptografijos sluoksnis veikia būtent po MEGA dangčiu yra pelytės judesių rinkimas registracijos metu, slaptažodžio atkurimo galimybės nebuvimas ir nauji būdai, kuriais vyksta failų perdavimai. Šiandien, milijonai verslų ir asmeninių vartotojų pasitiki MEGA saugumu ir patikimai joje laiko petabaitus duomenų ir mes tikime, kad ši sekmė yra MEGA noro pereiti į saugesnius debesis rezultatas.
1823: Mes nuolatos samdome darbuotojus. Jeigu esate išskirtinis programuotojas ir norėtumėte prisijungti prie mūsų komandos, nedvejodami atsiųskite savo CV į jobs@mega.co.nz.
1824: Jūs šiuo metu esate prisijungęs. Ar norėtumėte atsijungti ir užregistruoti naują paskyrą?
1826: MEGAsync yra įdiegama programa, kuri sinchronizuoja aplankus tarp jūsų kompiuterio ir jūsų MEGA cloud disko. Visi failai ir poaplankiai bus atkartojami dvejopai. Pakeitimai, kuriuos jūs padarysite vienoje pusėje, atsikartos kitoje pusėje beveik realiu laiku.
1828: Eikite į [A]atsisiuntimo puslapį[/A] ir sekite nurodymus. Diegimo metu jūsų bus paprašyta įvesti arba sukurti MEGA paskyrą ir nurodyti aplankus, kuriuos norite atkartoti (pilną MEGA cloud diską ir aplankų struktūrą į vieną vietos aplanką ar tam tikrus poaplankius jūsų cloud diske į atitinkamus vietos aplankus). Kai diegimas bus baigtas, MEGAsync bus paleista automatiškai. Su Windows jūs matysite paspaudžiamą MEGA logotipą užduočių juostoje tol, kol sinchronizavimo įrankis bus įjungtas. Jis suteiks jums prieigą prie būsenos lango ir nustatymų puslapio.
1829: Ar aš galiu naudotis MEGAsync keliuose kompiuteriuose?
1830: Taip. Sinchronizuojant kelis įrenginius su tuo pačiu cloud aplanku, jūs galite turėti kelių skirtingų kompiuterių sinchronizavimą (jei jūs naudojate tą pačią MEGA paskyrą kiekviename įrenginyje).
1831: Kaip aš galiu stebėti mano vietos failų ir aplankų sinchronizavimo būsena?
1832: Sinchronizuojamų failų ir aplankų piktogramos bus pažymėtos žaliu apskritimu. Vykstantis perdavimai žymimi mėlynu apskritimu; laukiantys perdavimai atvaizduojami raudonai.
1833: MEGAsync saugo mano prisijungimo duomenis tam, kad atliktų automatišką prisijungimą. Ar tai nėra saugumo klausimas?
1834: Ne, jeigu jūsų vietos diskas nuolatos bus šifruojamas (kodėl jūs turėtumėte norėti sinchronizuoti failus iš šifruojamos cloud saugyklos į nešifruojamą vietos diską?).
1835: Aš ištryniau failą iš sinchronizuojamo vietinio aplanko kai MEGAsync nebuvo įjungta. Kai aš paleidau ją, failas vėl pasirodė. Kodėl?
1836: Dabartinė MEGAsync versija neprisimena jūsų vietos failų sistemos būsenos tuo metu, kai programa yra paleidžiama iš naujo. Ji neturi galimybės žinoti, kad vietos failas buvo ištrintas tuo metu, kai ji buvo išjungta. Palikite MEGAsync visuomet įjungtą, jeigu norite, kad jūsų vietiniai ištrynimai būtų atkartoti tinkamai.
1837: Svarbus failas buvo užrašytas arba ištrintas sync client. Kaip aš galėčiau jį susigrąžinti?
1838: Cloud pusėje, ištrinti failai būna perkeliamį į specialų "SyncDebris" aplanką jūsų Šiukšliadėžėje ir gali būti susigrąžinti iš ten (jei reikia, naudokites integruota MEGA paieška). Vietiniame kompiuteryje, kiekvienas pagrindinis aplankas turi paslėpta "Debris" aplanką, į kurį būna talpinami ištrinti failai.
1839: Ar MEGAsync atlieka tikslų failo versijavimą?
1840: Ne. Tačiau jūs galite pasiekti užrašytus failus atitinkamuose debris aplankuose, kol šie nėra išvalyti.
1841: Ar MEGAsync palaiko esamų failų modifikavimą?

1845: Ar yra kokių nors apribojimų kalbant apie failų pavadinimus?
1846: MacOS/UNIX failų pavadinimai yra jautrūs didžiosioms ir mažosioms raidėms, o Windows - nėra. Aplankas kuris talpina abu, "ABC.TXT" ir "abc.txt" failus, gali būti sinchronizuotas į UNIX mašiną be jokių problemų, tačiau sinchronizuojant juos į Windows mašiną, tik vienas iš dviejų failų išliks.
1847: MEGA netaiko jokių apribojimų failų pavadinimams - jie gali būti sudaryti iš simbolių, kurie yra nesuderinami su operacine sistema, tokiais kaip : arba *. Jie bus perrašyti kaip %xx vietinėje pusėje ir konvertuojami į pradinę būsena sinchronizuojant juos atgal. Windows Tvarkyklė taip pat turi bėdą su iš pažiūros nekenksmingais failų ir aplankų pavadinimais, pavyzdžiui "con.doc" būtų nepasiekiamas (tam, kad suprastumėte kodėl, jūs turėtumėte būti geek'as arba veteranas, arba abu viename). Jeigu susidūrėte su tokia situacija, tiesiog perdavinkite failą cloud pusėje. Užsienio simboliai failų pavadinimuose yra pilnai palaikomi.
1848: MEGAsync palaiko gana gilias aplankų struktūras (pati MEGA jas yra apribojus iki ne daugiau kaip 63 lygių) ir labai ilgus vardus (iki 32,000 simbolių su Windows). Deja, daugelis Windows programinės įrangos (įskaitant ir Tvarkyklę) negali prieiti prie failų kurių vardai yra ilgesni nei 260 simbolių.

5909: MacOS/UNIX filenames are case sensitive, Windows filenames are not. A folder containing both "ABC.TXT" and "abc.txt" can be synced to a UNIX machine without problems, but when synced to a Windows machine, only one of the two files will survive.MEGA imposes no restrictions on filenames - they can contain characters that are incompatible with the operating system, such as : or *. These will be rewritten as %xx on the local side and converted back to the original character when synced back. The Windows Explorer also has trouble with a number of seemingly innocuous file and folder names - "con.doc", for example, would not be accessible (to understand why, you have to be a geek or a veteran, or both). If you encounter such a situation, simply rename the file on the cloud side. Foreign characters in filenames are fully supported.MEGAsync supports fairly deep folder structures (MEGA itself is limited to a maximum of 63 levels) and very long pathnames (up to 32,000 characters under Windows). Unfortunately, most Windows software (including the Explorer) is unable to access files whose path is longer than 260 characters.

6295: Copyright -  is a legal concept, enacted by most governments, giving the creator of an original work exclusive rights to it, usually for a limited time. Generally, it is "the right to copy", but also gives the copyright holder the right to be credited for the work, to determine who may adapt the work to other forms, who may perform the work, who may financially benefit from it, and other related rights. It is a form of intellectual property (like the patent, the trademark, and the trade secret) applicable to any expressible form of an idea or information that is substantive and discrete.

6378: You can relate bandwidth to the width of a highway, which then has multiple lanes for cars, depending on the width of the highway = maximum channel capacity at any given time of performing an upload or a download. The speed (of downloads/uploads) can be related to the speed of the cars. That is dependent on the state and speed of your computer, software, OS and versions, browsers and versions and your ISP provider. With Mega, you can control the 'speed' of downloads or of uploads, depending on your priorities in 'My Account' - 'Transfer Settings'.
6379: MEGA Bandwidth = the total amount of data, typically measured in MegaBytes or GigaBytes, that may be downloaded or uploaded from a particular web site or web hosting account during a given month. It is a frequency of a network connection between a local and a remote system (the remote system being your ISP), and your speed cannot exceed that of the frequency without changing the frequency (which is actually not changing the frequency, per se, but the wavelength).
6380: Our Free account has a dynamic bandwidth - allowance starts with 10 GB and increases 30 min after logging in.
6381: Pro I account bandwidth capacity is 1 TB per month (12 TB per year).
6382: Pro II and III have increased Bandwidth - 4 TB per month (48 TB per year) for PRO II and 8 TB per month (96 TB per year) for PRO III.

6384: You can have multiple downloads/uploads going depending on your bandwidth capacity. Uploads and downloads per browser tab can run in parallel and you can have several tabs open at the same time, even in a different browsers.
6385: Bandwidth restrictions: Our policy is not to impose any artificial restrictions on our users unless necessitated by infrastructure bottlenecks. We therefore reserve the right to cap user bandwidth utilization for operational reasons at any time on a per-IP basis. Your transfer queue will resume automatically once the congestion eases. No manual intervention is required.
6386: A PRO account gives you an additional storage space and extra bandwidth quota that we automatically draw from whenever an operational bandwidth limit is reached - you can use the quota yourself, or grant it to third parties accessing your data (this includes users without a MEGA account). The maximum percentage of your bandwidth quota allocated to third parties is configurable in your account settings.
6387: To sum it up - your bandwidth does not have any relation to 'speed' however greater bandwidth may improve the speed of your traffic indirectly.

6443: All files stored on MEGA are encrypted. All data transfers from and to MEGA are encrypted. And while most cloud storage providers can and do claim the same, MEGA is different – unlike the industry norm where the cloud storage provider holds the decryption key, with MEGA, you control the encryption, you hold the keys, and you decide who you grant or deny access to your files, without requiring any risky software installs. It’s all happening in your web browser!
6444: All our encryption is end-to-end. Data uploaded is encrypted on the uploading device before it is sent out to the Internet, and data downloaded is decrypted only after it has arrived on the downloading device. The client machines are responsible for generating, exchanging and managing the encryption keys. No usable encryption keys ever leave the client computers (with the exception of RSA public keys).
6445: The nominated and confirmed password for your MEGA account is also your unique master encryption key to your files. You could have noticed this being created upon your 'confirmation email' validation. The encryption key gets created from your password and to strengthen the key we have collected the entropy from your mouse movements and key stroke timings.
6446: Remember to keep your MEGA password secure and confidential at all times and generate your MASTER CRYPTO KEY for the event of misplacing your password in the future - https://mega.nz/#backup.
6447: No. Only file data and file/folder names are encrypted. Information that we need operational access to, such as your e-mail address, IP address, folder structure, file ownership and payment credentials, are stored and processed unencrypted. Please see our privacy policy for details.
6449: We make no use of the data a user stores with us because we cannot even decrypt it. MEGA uses a unique system of User Controlled Encryption. BEFORE your data leaves your browser, the file is encrypted (scrambled, unreadable) and then it leaves your computer, to be stored on the cloud as unreadable. The only way to decrypt/ make it readable is to download it back, while logged in to your file manager. Only when it reaches your browser, and realizes you are logged in with the correct credentials, does it begin decrypting (become readable). The only way to get the file is to be correctly logged into that account. This is UCE.
6450: Server controlled encryption (other storage providers) means the file is still readable when it is sent to the cloud, and then it is encrypted. When downloading, it is decrypted at the cloud, and then sent back to you fully readable. Not hard for prying eyes to see what is going on!

6459: All security is relative. The following attack vectors exist - they are not specific to MEGA, but we want you to know about the risks:
6461: - Spyware on your computer. A simple keylogger is enough, but session credentials and keys could also be extracted from memory or the filesystem.
6462: - Shoulder surfing. Do not type your password while someone could watch your keystrokes.
6464: - Phishing. Always confirm the security status of your connection (https://) and the correct domain name (mega.co.nz) before entering your password.
6465: Large-scale attacks could be mounted through:
6466: - A "man in the middle" attack. Requires issuing a valid duplicate SSL certificate in combination with DNS forging and/or attacks on our BGP routes (a DigiNotar-style scenario).
6467: - Gaining access to the webservers hosting https://mega.co.nz/index.html and replacing that file with a forged version (this would not affect access through the installed app base). Note that manipulating content on our distributed static content CDN does not pose a security risk, as all active content loaded from index.html is subject to verification with a cryptographic hash (think of it as some kind of "secure boot" for websites). This type of attack requires sending malicious code to the client and is therefore detectable.
6468: For bulk transfers, AES-128 (we believe that the higher CPU utilization of AES-192 and AES-256 outweighs the theoretical security benefit, at least until the advent of quantum computers). Post-download integrity checking is done through a chunked variation of CCM, which is less efficient than OCB, but not encumbered by patents.
6469: For establishing shared secrets between users and dropping files into your inbox, RSA-2048 (the key length was chosen as middle grounds between "too insecure" and "too slow"). All encryption, decryption and key generation is implemented in JavaScript, which limits throughput to a few MB/s and causes significant CPU load. We are looking forward to the implementation of the proposed HTML5 WebCrypto API in all major browsers, which will eliminate this bottleneck.
6470: There is no need to worry. Anything we do send through RC4 is already encrypted from the point it leaves your browser so there is no security risk. For increased security make sure you have our browser extensions installed. MEGA's users get to enjoy the privacy of their data with our User Controlled Encryption (UCE) mechanism - the only storage provider on the market offering this level of security and privacy.
6471: We are now conducting a single node tests to see in how much the server load will increase when using AES instead of RC4 so we can provide an alternative to those who have turned off RC4.
6472: For our customer's sake, some things are really important to us. One of these things is obviously security, whereas another one is performance. However, the former cannot be trumped by the latter!!!
6473: When you log in, receive the `secureboot.js` file, or when you're connecting to our API, you will *always* be running through a properly configured web server, which will give you strong authentication, strong encryption, as well as forward secrecy (PFS). These are the places where it matters that information is transferred in a secure fashion when using SSL/TLS!
6474: Afterwards, when you're accessing further static content, or when you're accessing your file storage, the client side (that is for example the JavaScript code in your browser, a browser extension, a
6475: sync client or a mobile app) will take care of ensuring security. Every content further loaded off of servers (e. g. the *.static.mega.co.nz servers) will be verified cryptographically by the client, and the content that could be seen on the wire is harmless. Every time data is transferred to or from our storage servers, the client side code will take care of proper, strong encryption, so that only ever the client alone is able to get access to the actual plain data.
6476: Given these circumstances, we could actually serve all static content and/or data transfers with our storage servers over a completely unencrypted connection. There would be *no* lack in security!
6477: However, browsers will refuse to allow for unencrypted HTTP connections (for good reasons) when originating from an HTTPS encrypted site, or they will at least display a degradation in security in the browser bar. This is all very good and common practice, especially if SSL/TLS is your line of defence when transmitting plain text data. For those reasons also, all subsequent connections generally should be of similar good strength in protection. However, as stated above, we don't actually need an encrypted HTTPS connection to uphold our protection (as we've taken care to completely encrypt the actual content already). But, we can't remove SSL/TLS (HTTPS) completely, as that would make the look in the browser "unhappy". Therefore, we have opted to use the weakest
6478: possible protection (RC4 with MD5) as a "NULL cipher" to prevent the browser from alarming people, whereas we would even be happy with an unencrypted connection altogether. This will give the end user an enhanced performance, *without* decreasing any security. And this is actually what our other clients are doing, they're getting rid of even RC4/MD5, but use strong SSL/TLS where needed.
6479: I hope this rather lengthy description has cleared up the situation, and lets you enjoy MEGA without a stale feeling of insecurity or security by hand waving. We really do take it seriously, and have put *lots* of thoughts into it.

6682: The privacy and security you get with browser based end to end encryption can take it's toll on speed as due to not all browsers provide complete HTML5 support. MEGA's users get to enjoy the privacy of their data with our User Controlled Encryption (UCE) mechanism - the only storage provider on the market offering this level of security and privacy.
6683: The speed of downloads/uploads is dependent on the state and speed of your computer, software, operating systems and versions and your ISP provider. With Mega, you can control the 'speed' of downloads or uploads, depending on your priorities in 'My Account' - 'Transfer Settings'. You can try to maximize your upload performance by disabling the 'Upload Speed Limit' as well.
6684: We do default the 'Upload Speed Limit' to enabled as many routers do not prioritize smaller packets in case of link congestion, resulting in your inbound traffic being severely affected when your outbound link is full. We therefore measure your available outbound bandwidth during the initial ten seconds of an upload and then keep at least 10% of it unused.
6685: The speed tests such as speedtest.net are great when you want to determine if your router or ISP has issues – you know what your speed ‘should’ be and this test indicates if there is an issue somewhere along the ‘lines’. However the result from speed test does not have a direct relation to speed with MEGA. The speed test will indicate whether everything is working right from the users or ISP’s end however there are other factors to take into consideration. Such as international peering issues (internet as a whole is currently experiencing: http://www.internetpulse.com/); the state of users computer (whether your software is up to date, whether your HDD and browser are clogged by temp or cached data or fragmented…); transfer speed also depends which server we are storing the data on.
6686: To sum it up - your Pro account's increased bandwidth does not have any relation to 'speed' however greater bandwidth may improve the speed of your traffic indirectly.

6714: In order for any of the following to make sense, I urge you to get into MEGA, and start testing for yourself, and see how what i am about to describe can apply!
6715: OK, the way to do this :
6716: Firstly, the leader of this project, or the file administrator would set up an account which would be considered the MASTER account - This can just be a normal Free account, or Pro (https://mega.nz/#pro) depending on your storage requirements.
6717: 1 - Each other user must have an account set up with MEGA.nz - They are Free :)
6718: 2 - You need to add each of their email IDs to your master account's Contacts.
6719: 3 - In your master account, it is up to you to set up the 'hierarchy' as described. E.g. you would create a different folder unique to each user, you could call it by their name.
6720: 4 - Once you have set up the 'hierarchy' to reach the level that you need uploaded to (e.g. User/ Event and sub folder, Users name)
6721: you can then 'right click' select sharing, and assign that user with FULL ACCESS!
6722: 5 - From here, this folder is effectively synced on both accounts, any modifications are visible at both accounts instantly!
6723: You then load files into that folder, and they will be visible at the other users account too, listed under their 'Incoming Shares'
6724: Then are also notifications to alert all users with access to that folder, of any recent activities such as new files added, removed etc.
6725: FULL Access allows both the master account, and the receiving account with full permissions to that folder. Each user could upload, download, modify and erase any content in that folder. The other permission levels are Read Only (no adding, no deleting) and Read and Write (you can add but not delete).
